revised_title: Relative Intensities of Magnetic Beta-Ray Spectra of Radium B and Radium C
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the relative intensities of the groups in the magnetic beta-ray spectra of radium B and radium C. They used a photographic method to record the spectra and found that the intensities of the beta-ray groups were related to the number of particles hitting the plate. This research provided valuable information about the nuclear transitions and the probability of certain stages in the beta-ray disintegration process.
